alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Pearl River (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 12:58PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central St. Tammany Parish, west central Hancock and southwestern Pearl River Counties through 130 PM CDT... At 1258 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Abita Springs to near Stennis Space Center. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Picayune, Pearl River, Abita Springs and Bush. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 4 and 11. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 6. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
